text: The 2019 Senior Open Championship was a senior major golf championship and the 33st Senior Open Championship, held from 25–28 July at Royal Lytham & St Annes Golf Club in Lytham, England. It was the 5th Senior Open Championship played at the course and the 17th Senior Open Championship played as a senior major championship. World Golf Hall of Fame member Bernhard Langer won by two strokes over Paul Broadhurst. The 2019 event was Langer's fourth Senior Open Championship title and his 11th senior major championship victory. ==Venue== The 2019 event was the fifth Senior Open Championship played at Royal Porthcawl. ===Course layout=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Hole!!Yards!!Par!!!!Hole!!Yards!!Par |- |1||198||3||rowspan=10 style="background:#E6E8FA;"| ||10||385||4 |- |2||455||4||11||540||5 |- |3||477||4||12||196||3 |- |4||416||4||13||357||4 |- |5||188||3||14||443||4 |- |6||474||4||15||464||4 |- |7||589||5||16||343||4 |- |8||417||4||17||432||4 |- |9||164||3||18||410||4 |- | Out||3,378||34|| In||3,570||36 |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:left;"|Source: ||colspan=3|Total ||6,948||70 |} ==Field== The field consisted of 144 competitors: 136 professionals and 8 amateurs. An 18-hole stroke play qualifying round was held on Monday, 22 July for players who were not already exempt. ===Past champions in the field=== ====Made the cut==== {| class="wikitable"
